title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 5901.6 - Award selection process and designation
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 5901.6 - Award selection process and designation

State Regulations
(a) The office shall designate regional
technology development centers in regions throughout the State. Centers shall
be designated for a period not greater than five years through a competitive
selection process. The office reserves the right to reject any or all
proposals. There shall be no limit on the number of times a center may be
redesignated. (b) The office shall
review, on an annual basis, the performance of each designated regional
technology development center. Criteria shall include, but need not be limited
to, the number of jobs created or retained, the number and types of companies
assisted, and the impact of such assistance on the companies' competitive
position. Notes

5901.6

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
